Clicked Add new policy, selected Start from scratch, explored Leave allowance options (Calendar days, Working days), clicked Unpaid leave button to reveal daily wage formula configuration with disabled fields showing override from payroll settings.

claims.claim: Verify system acknowledges month length variations in calculation

claims.claim: Verify override indicator showing which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
claims.observed_truth: Clear override indicator present in EOS configuration. Additionally, an alert at the top states: 'This change will affect new requests in 14 unpaid - leave policies'. These indicators clearly show override precedence and impact scope.

claims.claim: Verify system preserves and displays initially calculated daily rate
claims.observed_truth: Cannot verify rate preservation in configuration interface. This check requires examining stored vs displayed rates in leave request details or payroll deduction records. The configuration interface only defines how rates are calculated, not how they are preserved and displayed.
claims.notes: check_id: check_initial_rate_preservation, type: content_presence, plan_id: plan_unpaid_leave_daily_rate_display, source: jira TSSD-1807

provenance.selector_hint: Stored rate indicator or documentation in leave deduction display

what_worked.summary: Configuration interface does not show stored rate display behavior.
gotchas: Requires viewing actual leave request or deduction records
